member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag
member.summary: This class extends , providing support for accessing and modifying a collection of tags appearing at the end of a file.

remarks.para: This class is used by to read all the tags appearing at the end of the file but could be used by other classes. It currently supports ID3v1, ID3v2, and APE tags.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.file
member.summary: Contains the file to operate on.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.read_size
member.summary: Contains the number of bytes that must be read to hold all applicable indicators.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.#ctor(VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.File)
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of for a specified .
member.param: A object on which the new instance will perform its operations.
member.remarks: Constructing a new instance does not automatically read the contents from the disk. must be called to read the tags.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.TotalSize
member.summary: Gets the total size of the tags located at the end of the file by reading from the file.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.Read(VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.ReadStyle)
member.summary: Reads the tags stored at the end of the file into the current instance.
member.returns: A value indicating the seek position in the file at which the read tags begin. This also marks the seek position at which the media ends.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.Render
member.summary: Renders the tags contained in the current instance.
member.returns: A object containing the physical representation of the tags stored in the current instance.
member.remarks: The tags are rendered in the order that they are stored in the current instance.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.Write
member.summary: Writes the tags contained in the current instance to the end of the file that created it, overwriting the existing tags.
member.returns: A value indicating the seek position in the file at which the written tags begin. This also marks the seek position at which the media ends.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.RemoveTags(VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.TagTypes)
member.summary: Removes a set of tag types from the current instance.
member.param: A bitwise combined value containing tag types to be removed from the file.
member.remarks: In order to remove all tags from a file, pass as .

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.EndTag.AddTag(VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.TagTypes,VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag)
member.summary: Adds a tag of a specified type to the current instance, optionally copying values from an existing type.
member.param: A value specifying the type of tag to add to the current instance. At the time of this writing, this is limited to , , and .
A to copy values from using , or if no tag is to be copied.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.File
member.summary: This abstract class extends to provide tagging and properties for files that contain an indeterminite number of tags at their beginning or end.

remarks.para: When extending this class, , , and should be overrided methods that read the format specific information from the file.
The file is read upon construction in the following manner:

item.term: The file is opened for reading.
The tags at the start of the file are read.
The tags at the end of the file are read.
If reading with a style other than , is called.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.File.ReadStart(System.Int64,VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.ReadStyle)
member.summary: Reads format specific information at the start of the file.
member.param: A value containing the seek position at which the tags end and the media data begins.
A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.
member.remarks: This method is called by the constructor immediately after the tags at the start of the file have been read and as such (so the internal seek mechanism is close to the start). It should be used for reading any content specific information, such as an audio header from the start of the file.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.File.ReadEnd(System.Int64,VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.ReadStyle)
member.summary: Reads format specific information at the end of the file.
member.param: A value containing the seek position at which the media data ends and the tags begin.
A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.
member.remarks: This method is called by the constructor immediately after the tags at the end of the file have been read and as such (so the internal seek mechanism is close to the end). It should be used for reading any content specific information, such as an audio header from the end of the file.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.NonContainer.File.ReadProperties(System.Int64,System.Int64,VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.ReadStyle)
member.summary: Reads the audio properties from the file represented by the current instance.
member.param: A value containing the seek position at which the tags end and the media data begins.
A value containing the seek position at which the media data ends and the tags begin.
A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.
member.returns: A object describing the media properties of the file represented by the current instance.
member.remarks: This method is called ONLY IF the file is constructed with a read style other than , and as such MUST NOT return . It is guaranteed that and will have been called first and this method should be strictly used to perform final processing on already read data.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Ogg.Codec.CodecProvider
member.summary: Represents a method capable of checking an Ogg header packet to see it is matches a given codec.
member.param: A object containing an Ogg header packet.
member.returns: A object capable of processing the stream from which the packet was generated; otherwise .

remarks.para: In order to add support for a new Ogg codec in TagLib#, a derivative class of needs to be created. The class then needs to be added to the codec detection system by creating a and registering it with .

A method implementing should read to determine if it's subclass can handle the data. If it can, it should return a new instance of that class, but in no way act upon the data. If the class cannot be used to read the packet, indicates to the system that it needs to try anther codec provider.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Ogg.Page.OverwriteSequenceNumbers(VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Ogg.File,System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.UInt32,System.Int32})
member.summary: Overwrites all page headers in a file starting at a specified position, shifting the page sequence numbers a set amount.
member.param: A object containing the file to update.
A value specify at what position to start updating.
A object where the key is the serial number of the stream to update and the value is the amount to offset the page sequence numbers in the stream.
member.remarks: When the number of pages in a stream changes, all subsequent pages in the stream need to have their page sequence number update in order to remain valid. Additionally, when the page sequence number changes, the page needs to have its checksum recomputed. This makes for a costly recalculation if large comment data is added.

member.value: A containing the sort name of the Track Title of the media described by the current instance or null if no value is present.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Ogg.XiphComment.Subtitle
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description, one-liner. It represents the tagline of the Video/music.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field gives a nice/short precision to the title, which is typically below the title on the front cover of a media. For example, for "Back to the future", this would be "It's About Time".

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "SUBTITLE" non-standard field.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Ogg.XiphComment.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description of the media. For a music, this could be the comment that the artist made of its artwork. For a video, this should be a short summary of the story/plot, but a spoiler. This should give the impression of what to expect in the media.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "DESCRIPTION" field. http://musicbrainz.org/doc/PicardTagMapping

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Ogg.XiphComment.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "ARTIST" field.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Ogg.XiphComment.PerformersSort

member.value: A containing the sort names for the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance, or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "ARTISTSORT" field. http://musicbrainz.org/doc/PicardTagMapping

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Ogg.XiphComment.PerformersRole
member.summary: Gets and sets the Charaters for a video media, or instruments played for music media. This should match the array (for each person correspond one/more role). Several roles for the same artist/actor can be made up with semicolons. For example, "Marty McFly; Marty McFly Jr.; Marlene McFly".

remarks.para: This is typically usefull for movies, although the instrument played by each artist in a music may be of relevance.
It is highly important to match each role to the performers. This means that a role may be to keep the match between a Performers[i] and PerformersRole[i].

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "ARTISTROLE" non-standard field.

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "ALBUMARTIST" field.

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "ALBUMARTISTSORT" field. http://musicbrainz.org/doc/PicardTagMapping

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.PictureLazy
member.summary: This class implements and provides mechanisms for loading pictures from files. Contrary to , a reference to a file where the picture is located can be given and the picture is lazily loaded from the file, meaning that it will be read from the file only when needed. This saves time and memory if the picture loading is not required.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Png.File.ReadChunkLength
member.summary: Reads the length of data of a chunk from the current position
member.returns: A with the length of data.
member.remarks: The length is stored in a 4-byte unsigned integer in the file, but due to the PNG specification this value does not exceed 2^31-1 and can therfore be safely returned as an signed integer. This prevents unsafe casts for using the length as parameter for other methods.

member.param: A with the length of the Chunk Data.

member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the title for the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 32 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Riff.DivXTag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 28 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored, minus a byte for each additionial performer (i.e. two performers will only have 27 bytes and three performers will only have 26 bytes).This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Riff.DivXTag.Comment
member.summary: Gets and sets a user comment on the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing user comments on the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 48 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Riff.DivXTag.Genres
member.summary: Gets and sets the genres of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the genres of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: Only first genre will be stored and only if it is an exact match for a value appearing in . All other values will result in the property being cleared.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Riff.DivXTag.Year
member.summary: Gets and sets the year that the media represented by the current instance was recorded.
member.value: A containing the year that the media represented by the current instance was created or zero if no value is present.
member.remarks: Only values between 1 and 9999 will be stored, all other values will result in the property being zeroed.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.SupportedMimeType
member.summary: This class provides an attribute for listing supported mime-types for classes that extend .
member.remarks: When classes that extend are registered with , its attributes are read.

member.summary: Contains the registered objects.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.SupportedMimeType.#cctor
member.summary: Constructs and initializes the class by initializing the class.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.SupportedMimeType.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the attribute for a specified mime-type.
member.param: A object containing a standard mime-type.

remarks.para: Standard practice is to use to register standard mime-types, like "audio/mp3" and "video/mpeg" and to use strictly to register extensions, using "taglib/ext" for the mime type. Eg. SupportedMimeType("taglib/mp3", "mp3").

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.SupportedMimeType.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the attribute for a specified mime-type and extension.
member.param: A object containing a standard mime-type.
A object containing a file extension.

remarks.para: Standard practice is to use to register standard mime-types, like "audio/mp3" and "video/mpeg" and to use strictly to register extensions, using "taglib/ext" for the mime type. Eg. SupportedMimeType("taglib/mp3", "mp3").

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.SupportedMimeType.MimeType
member.summary: Gets the mime-type registered by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the mime-type registered by the current instance.

remarks.para: The value is in the format "generic/specific". For example, "video/mp4".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.SupportedMimeType.Extension
member.summary: Gets the extension registered by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the extension registered by the current instance, or if not specified.

remarks.para: The value is the file extension minus the preceding ".". For example, "m4v".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.SupportedMimeType.AllMimeTypes
member.summary: Gets all the mime-types that have been registered with .
member.value: A object containing all the mime-types that have been registered with .

remarks.para: These values are used by to match file types.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.SupportedMimeType.AllExtensions
member.summary: Gets all the extensions that have been registered with .
member.value: A object containing all the extensions that have been registered with .

remarks.para: These values are currently not used in file type recognition.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag
member.summary: This abstract class provides generic access to standard tag features. All tag types will extend this class.
member.remarks: Because not every tag type supports the same features, it may be useful to check that the value is stored by re-reading the property after it is stored.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.TagTypes
member.summary: Gets the tag types contained in the current instance.
member.value: A bitwise combined containing the tag types contained in the current instance.
member.remarks: For a standard tag, the value should be intuitive. For example, objects have a value of . However, for tags of type may contain multiple or no types.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the title for the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: The title is most commonly the name of the song or episode or a movie title. For example, "Daydream Believer" (a song by the Monkies), "Space Seed" (an episode of Star Trek), or "Harold and Kumar Go To White Castle" (a movie).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.TitleSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort name for the title of the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the sort name for the title of the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: Possibly used to sort compilations, or episodic content.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Subtitle
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description, one-liner. It represents the tagline of the Video/music.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field gives a nice/short precision to the title, which is typically below the title on the front cover of a media. For example, for "Back to the future", this would be "It's About Time".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description of the media. For a music, this could be the comment that the artist made of its artwork. For a video, this should be a short summary of the story/plot, but a spoiler. This should give the impression of what to expect in the media.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This is especially relevant for a movie. For example, for "Back to the Future 2", this could be "After visiting 2015, Marty McFly must repeat his visit to 1955 to prevent disastrous changes to 1985...without interfering with his first trip".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is most commonly called "Artists" in Audio media, or "Actor" in Video media, and should be used to represent each artist/actor appearing in the media. It can be simple in the form of "The Beatles" or more complicated in the form of "John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison, Pete Best", depending on the preferences of the listener/spectator and the degree to which they organize their media collection.
As the preference of the user may vary, applications should not try to limit the user in what choice they may make.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.PerformersSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names of the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance, or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This is used to provide more control over how tracks are sorted. Typical uses are to skip common prefixes or sort by last name. For example, "The Beatles" might be sorted as "Beatles, The".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.PerformersRole
member.summary: Gets and sets the Charaters for a video media, or instruments played for music media. This should match the array (for each person correspond one/more role). Several roles for the same artist/actor can be made up with semicolons. For example, "Marty McFly; Marty McFly Jr.; Marlene McFly".

remarks.para: This is typically usefull for movies, although the instrument played by each artist in a music may be of relevance.
It is highly important to match each role to the performers. This means that a role may be to keep the match between a Performers[i] and PerformersRole[i].

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.AlbumArtists
member.summary: Gets and sets the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is typically optional but aids in the sorting of compilations or albums with multiple artists. For example, if an album has several artists, sorting by artist will split up the album and sorting by album will split up albums by the same artist. Having a single album artist for an entire album will solve this problem.

As this value is to be used as a sorting key, it should be used with less variation than . Where performers can be broken into muliple artist it is best to stick with a single band name. For example, "The Beatles".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.AlbumArtistsSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names for the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is typically optional but aids in the sorting of compilations or albums with multiple artists. For example, if an album has several artists, sorting by artist will split up the album and sorting by album will split up albums by the same artist. Having a single album artist for an entire album will solve this problem.

As this value is to be used as a sorting key, it should be used with less variation than . Where performers can be broken into muliple artist it is best to stick with a single band name. For example, "Beatles, The".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Composers
member.summary: Gets and sets the composers of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the composers of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the composers, song writers, script writers, or persons who claim authorship of the media.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.ComposersSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names for the composers of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the composers of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is typically optional but aids in the sorting of compilations or albums with multiple Composers.

As this value is to be used as a sorting key, it should be used with less variation than . Where performers can be broken into muliple artist it is best to stick with a single composer. For example, "McCartney, Paul".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Album
member.summary: Gets and sets the album of the media represented by the current instance. For a video media, this represent the collection the video belongs to.
member.value: A object containing the album of the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the name of the album the media belongs to. In the case of a boxed set, it should be the name of the entire set rather than the individual disc. In case of a Serie, this should be name of the serie, rather than the season of a serie.

For example, "Rubber Soul" (an album by the Beatles), "The Sopranos: Complete First Season" (a boxed set of TV episodes), "Back To The Future" (a serie of movies/sequels), or "Game of Thrones" (a serie with several seasons).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.AlbumSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names for the Album Title of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the Album Title of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is typically optional but aids in the sorting of compilations or albums with Similar Titles.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Comment
member.summary: Gets and sets a user comment on the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing user comments on the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field should be used to store user notes and comments. There is no constraint on what text can be stored here, but it should not contain program information.

Because this field contains notes that the user might think of while listening to the media, it may be useful for an application to make this field easily accessible, perhaps even including it in the main interface.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Genres
member.summary: Gets and sets the genres of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the genres of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents genres that apply to the song, album or video. This is often used for filtering media.
A list of common audio genres as popularized by ID3v1, are stored in . Additionally, contains video genres as used by DivX.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Year
member.summary: Gets and sets the year that the media represented by the current instance was recorded.
member.value: A containing the year that the media represented by the current instance was created or zero if no value is present.

remarks.para: Years greater than 9999 cannot be stored by most tagging formats and will be cleared if a higher value is set.
Some tagging formats store higher precision dates which will be truncated when this property is set. Format specific implementations are necessary access the higher precision values.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Track
member.summary: Gets and sets the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album, or season (for series).
member.value: A containing the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: This value should be the same as is listed on the album cover and no more than if is non-zero.
Most tagging formats store this as a string. To help sorting, a two-digit zero-filled value is used in the resulting tag.
For a serie, this property represents the episode in a season of the serie.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.TrackCount
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of tracks in the album, or the number of episodes in a serie, of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the number of tracks in the album, or the number of episodes in a serie, of the media represented by the current instance or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: If non-zero, this value should be at least equal to . If is zero, this value should also be zero.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Disc
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of the disc containing the media represented by the current instance in the boxed set. For a serie, this represents the season number.
member.value: A containing the number of the disc or season of the media represented by the current instance in the boxed set.

remarks.para: This value should be the same as is number that appears on the disc. For example, if the disc is the first of three, the value should be 1. It should be no more than if is non-zero.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.DiscCount
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of discs or seasons in the boxed set containing the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the number of discs or seasons in the boxed set containing the media represented by the current instance or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: If non-zero, this value should be at least equal to . If is zero, this value should also be zero.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Lyrics
member.summary: Gets and sets the lyrics or script of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the lyrics or script of the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field contains a plain text representation of the lyrics or scripts with line breaks and whitespace being the only formatting marks.
Some formats support more advances lyrics, like synchronized lyrics, but those must be accessed using format specific implementations.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Grouping
member.summary: Gets and sets the grouping on the album which the media in the current instance belongs to.
member.value: A object containing the grouping on the album which the media in the current instance belongs to or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field contains a non-physical grouping to which the track belongs. In classical music, this could be a movement. It could also be parts of a series like "Introduction", "Closing Remarks", etc.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.BeatsPerMinute
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of beats per minute in the audio of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the number of beats per minute in the audio of the media represented by the current instance, or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: This field is useful for DJ's who are trying to match songs. It should be calculated from the audio or pulled from a database.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Conductor
member.summary: Gets and sets the conductor or director of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the conductor or director of the media represented by the current instance or if no value present.

remarks.para: This field is most useful for organizing classical music and movies.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Copyright
member.summary: Gets and sets the copyright information for the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the copyright information for the media represented by the current instance or if no value present.

remarks.para: This field should be used for storing copyright information. It may be useful to show this information somewhere in the program while the media is playing.
Players should not support editing this field, but media creation tools should definitely allow modification.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.DateTagged
member.summary: Gets and sets the date at which the tag has been written.
member.value: A nullable object containing the date at which the tag has been written, or if no value present.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzArtistId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Artist ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ArtistID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ArtistID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Artist of the track.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseGroupId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release Group ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseGroupID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseGroupID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Release Group to which this track belongs.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Release to which this track belongs.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseArtistId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release Artist ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseArtistID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz Release ArtistID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Album Artist credited with the Album.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzTrackId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Track ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz TrackID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz TrackID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular track.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzDiscId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Disc ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz DiscID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz DiscID, and is used to uniquely identify the particular Released Media associated with this track.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicIpId
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicIP PUID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicIP PUID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicIP PUID, and is an acoustic fingerprint identifier. It Identifies what this track "Sounds Like".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.AmazonId
member.summary: Gets and sets the Amazon ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the AmazonID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the AmazonID, and is used to identify the particular track or album in the Amazon Catalog.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseStatus
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release Status of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseStatus of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseStatus, and is used to describes how 'official' a Release is. Common Status are: Official, Promotion, Bootleg, Pseudo-release.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseType
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release Type of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseType of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseType, that describes what kind of release a Release is.. Common Status are: Single, Album, EP, Compilation, Soundtrack, SpokenWord, Interview, Audiobook, Live, Remix, and Other. Careful thought must be given when using this field to decide if a particular track "Is a Compilation".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseCountry
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz Release Country of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseCountry of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseCountry, that describes the country in which an album was released. Note that the ReleaseCountry of an album is not necessarily the country in which it was produced. The label itself will typically be more relevant. eg, a release on "Foo Records UK" that has "Made in Austria" printed on it, will likely be a UK release.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.ReplayGainTrackGain

remarks.para: Typically, this value is used to store an album cover or icon to use for the file, but it is capable of holding any type of image, including pictures of the band, the recording studio, the concert, etc.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.Duplicate(VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag,VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies all standard values from one tag to another, optionally overwriting existing values.
member.param: A object containing the source tag to copy the values from.
A object containing the target tag to copy values to.
A specifying whether or not to copy values over existing one.

remarks.para: This method only copies the most basic values, those contained in this class, between tags. To copy format specific tags, or additional details, additional implementations need to be applied. For example, copying from one to another: foreach (TagLib.Id3v2.Frame frame in old_tag) new_tag.AddFrame (frame);

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag.CopyTo(VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.Tag,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies the values from the current instance to another , optionally overwriting existing values.
member.param: A object containing the target tag to copy values to.
A specifying whether or not to copy values over existing one.

remarks.para: This method only copies the most basic values when copying between different tag formats, however, if is of the same type as the current instance, more advanced copying may be done. For example, will copy all of its frames to another tag.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.TagLib.UnsupportedFormatException
member.summary: This class extends and is used to indicate that a file or tag is stored in an unsupported format and cannot be read or written by the current implementation.

example.para: Catching an exception when creating a .
example.code:
Imports System Imports TagLib
Public Class ExceptionTest Public Shared Sub Main () Try file As File = File.Create ("myfile.flv") ' Not supported, YET! Catch e As UnsupportedFormatException Console.WriteLine ("That file format is not supported: {0}", e.ToString ()); End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.Accord.Imaging.MatrixH
member.summary: Encapsulates a 3-by-3 general transformation matrix that represents a (possibly) non-linear transform.

remarks.para: Linear transformations are not the only ones that can be represented by matrices. Using homogeneous coordinates, both affine transformations and perspective projections on R^n can be represented as linear transformations on R^n+1 (that is, n+1-dimensional real projective space).
The general transformation matrix has 8 degrees of freedom, as the last element is just a scale parameter.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.Accord.Imaging.Moments.CentralMoments
member.summary: Central image moments.

remarks.para: In image processing, computer vision and related fields, an image moment is a certain particular weighted average (moment) of the image pixels' intensities, or a function of such moments, usually chosen to have some attractive property or interpretation.

Image moments are useful to describe objects after segmentation. Simple properties of the image which are found via image moments include area (or total intensity), its centroid, and information about its orientation.
The central moments can be used to find the location, center of mass and the dimensions of a given object within an image.

References:

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.Accord.Imaging.Moments.RawMoments
member.summary: Raw image moments.

remarks.para: In image processing, computer vision and related fields, an image moment is a certain particular weighted average (moment) of the image pixels' intensities, or a function of such moments, usually chosen to have some attractive property or interpretation.

Image moments are useful to describe objects after segmentation. Simple properties of the image which are found via image moments include area (or total intensity), its centroid, and information about its orientation.
The raw moments are the most basic moments which can be computed from an image, and can then be further processed to achieve or even .

References:
Wikipedia contributors. "Image moment." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Available at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image_moment

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.Accord.Imaging.PointH
member.summary: Represents an ordered pair of real x- and y-coordinates and scalar w that defines a point in a two-dimensional plane using homogeneous coordinates.

remarks.para: In mathematics, homogeneous coordinates are a system of coordinates used in projective geometry much as Cartesian coordinates are used in Euclidean geometry.

They have the advantage that the coordinates of a point, even those at infinity, can be represented using finite coordinates. Often formulas involving homogeneous coordinates are simpler and more symmetric than their Cartesian counterparts.

Homogeneous coordinates have a range of applications, including computer graphics, where they allow affine transformations and, in general, projective transformations to be easily represented by a matrix.

References:
http://alumnus.caltech.edu/~woody/docs/3dmatrix.html
http://simply3d.wordpress.com/2009/05/29/homogeneous-coordinates/

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.Accord.Vision.Detection.HaarCascade
member.summary: Cascade of Haar-like features' weak classification stages.

remarks.para: The Viola-Jones object detection framework is the first object detection framework to provide competitive object detection rates in real-time proposed in 2001 by Paul Viola and Michael Jones. Although it can be trained to detect a variety of object classes, it was motivated primarily by the problem of face detection.

The implementation of this code has used Viola and Jones' original publication, the OpenCV Library and the Marilena Project as reference. OpenCV is released under a BSD license, it is free for both academic and commercial use. Please be aware that some particular versions of the Haar object detection framework are patented by Viola and Jones and may be subject to restrictions for use in commercial applications.

References:
Viola, P. and Jones, M. (2001). Rapid Object Detection using a Boosted Cascade of Simple Features.
Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Viola-Jones object detection framework

example.para: To load an OpenCV-compatible XML definition for a Haar cascade, you can use HaarCascade's FromXml static method. An example would be:
example.code: String path = @"C:\Users\haarcascade-frontalface_alt2.xml"; HaarCascade cascade1 = HaarCascade.FromXml(path);
example.para: After the cascade has been loaded, it is possible to create a new using the cascade. Please see for more details. It is also possible to generate embeddable C# definitions from a cascade, avoiding the need to load XML files on program startup. Please see method or class for details.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.Accord.Vision.Detection.HaarClassifier
member.summary: Strong classifier based on a weaker cascade of classifiers using Haar-like rectangular features.

remarks.para: The Viola-Jones object detection framework is the first object detection framework to provide competitive object detection rates in real-time proposed in 2001 by Paul Viola and Michael Jones. Although it can be trained to detect a variety of object classes, it was motivated primarily by the problem of face detection.

The implementation of this code has used Viola and Jones' original publication, the OpenCV Library and the Marilena Project as reference. OpenCV is released under a BSD license, it is free for both academic and commercial use. Please be aware that some particular versions of the Haar object detection framework are patented by Viola and Jones and may be subject to restrictions for use in commercial applications. The code has been implemented with full support for tilted Haar features.

References:
Viola, P. and Jones, M. (2001). Rapid Object Detection using a Boosted Cascade of Simple Features.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viola-Jones_object_detection_framework

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.Accord.Vision.Detection.HaarObjectDetector
member.summary: Viola-Jones Object Detector based on Haar-like features.

remarks.para: The Viola-Jones object detection framework is the first object detection framework to provide competitive object detection rates in real-time proposed in 2001 by Paul Viola and Michael Jones. Although it can be trained to detect a variety of object classes, it was motivated primarily by the problem of face detection.

The implementation of this code has used Viola and Jones' original publication, the OpenCV Library and the Marilena Project as reference. OpenCV is released under a BSD license, it is free for both academic and commercial use. Please be aware that some particular versions of the Haar object detection framework are patented by Viola and Jones and may be subject to restrictions for use in commercial applications. The code has been implemented with full support for tilted Haar features from the ground up.

References:
Viola, P. and Jones, M. (2001). Rapid Object Detection using a Boosted Cascade of Simple Features.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viola-Jones_object_detection_framework

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum threshold used to supress rectangles which have not been detected sufficient number of times. This property only has effect when is set to .

remarks.para: The value of this property represets the minimum amount of detections made inside a region to report this region as an actual detection. For example, setting this property to two will discard all regions which had not achieved at least two detected rectangles within it.
Setting this property to a value higher than zero may decrease the number of false positives.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.Accord.Vision.Tracking.Camshift
member.summary: Continuously Adaptive Mean Shift (Camshift) Object Tracker

remarks.para: Camshift stands for "Continuously Adaptive Mean Shift". It combines the basic Mean Shift algorithm with an adaptive region-sizing step. The kernel is a step function applied to a probability map. The probability of each image pixel is based on color using a method called histogram backprojection.

The implementation of this code has used Gary Bradski's original publication, the OpenCV Library and the FaceIt implementation as references. The OpenCV library is distributed under a BSD license. FaceIt is distributed under a MIT license. The original licensing terms for FaceIt are described in the source code and in the Copyright.txt file accompanying the framework.

References:
G.R. Bradski, Computer video face tracking for use in a perceptual user interface, Intel Technology Journal, Q2 1998. Available on:
ftp://download.intel.com/technology/itj/q21998/pdf/camshift.pdf
R. Hewitt, Face tracking project description: Camshift Algorithm. Available on:
http://www.robinhewitt.com/research/track/camshift.html
OpenCV Computer Vision Library. Available on:
http://sourceforge.net/projects/opencvlibrary/
FaceIt object tracking in Flash AS3. Available on:
http://www.libspark.org/browser/as3/FaceIt

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.DoublePoint
member.summary: Structure for representing a pair of coordinates of double type.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Parallel
member.summary: The class provides support for parallel computations, paralleling loop's iterations.

remarks.para: The class allows to parallel loop's iteration computing them in separate threads, what allows their simultaneous execution on multiple CPUs/cores.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Parallel.ForLoopBody
member.summary: Delegate defining for-loop's body.
member.param: Loop's index.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Parallel.ThreadsCount
member.summary: Number of threads used for parallel computations.

remarks.para: The property sets how many worker threads are created for paralleling loops' computations.
By default the property is set to number of CPU's in the system (see ).

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob
member.summary: Image's blob.

remarks.para: The class represents a blob - part of another images. The class encapsulates the blob itself and information about its position in parent image.

para.note: The class is not responsible for blob's image disposing, so it should be done manually when it is required.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob.Image
member.summary: Blob's image.

remarks.para: The property keeps blob's image. In the case if it equals to null, the image may be extracted using or method.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob.OriginalSize
member.summary: Blob's image size.

remarks.para: The property specifies size of the blob's image. If the property is set to , the blob's image size equals to the size of original image. If the property is set to , the blob's image size equals to size of actual blob.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob.Rectangle
member.summary: Blob's rectangle in the original image.

remarks.para: The property specifies position of the blob in the original image and its size.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob.ID
member.summary: Blob's ID in the original image.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob.Area
member.summary: Blob's area.

remarks.para: The property equals to blob's area measured in number of pixels contained by the blob.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob.Fullness
member.summary: Blob's fullness, [0, 1].

remarks.para: The property equals to blob's fullness, which is calculated as Area / ( Width * Height ). If it equals to 1, then it means that entire blob's rectangle is filled by blob's pixel (no blank areas), which is true only for rectangles. If it equals to 0.5, for example, then it means that only half of the bounding rectangle is filled by blob's pixels.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob.CenterOfGravity
member.summary: Blob's center of gravity point.

remarks.para: The property keeps center of gravity point, which is calculated as mean value of X and Y coordinates of blob's points.

member.summary: Blob's mean color.

remarks.para: The property keeps mean color of pixels comprising the blob.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob.ColorStdDev
member.summary: Blob color's standard deviation.

remarks.para: The property keeps standard deviation of pixels' colors comprising the blob.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounter
member.summary: Blob counter - counts objects in image, which are separated by black background.

remarks.para: The class counts and extracts stand alone objects in images using connected components labeling algorithm.

para.note: The algorithm treats all pixels with values less or equal to as background, but pixels with higher values are treated as objects' pixels.

remarks.para: For blobs' searching the class supports 8 bpp indexed grayscale images and 24/32 bpp color images that are at least two pixels wide. Images that are one pixel wide can be processed if they are rotated first, or they can be processed with . See documentation about for information about which pixel formats are supported for extraction of blobs.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounter.BackgroundThreshold
member.summary: Background threshold's value.

remarks.para: The property sets threshold value for distinguishing between background pixel and objects' pixels. All pixel with values less or equal to this property are treated as background, but pixels with higher values are treated as objects' pixels.

para.note: In the case of colour images a pixel is treated as objects' pixel if any of its RGB values are higher than corresponding values of this threshold.
For processing grayscale image, set the property with all RGB components eqaul.

remarks.para: Default value is set to (0, 0, 0) - black colour.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.ObjectsOrder
member.summary: Possible object orders.
member.remarks: The enumeration defines possible sorting orders of objects, found by blob counting classes.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.ObjectsOrder.None
member.summary: Unsorted order (as it is collected by algorithm).

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.ObjectsOrder.Size
member.summary: Objects are sorted by size in descending order (bigger objects go first). Size is calculated as Width * Height.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.ObjectsOrder.Area
member.summary: Objects are sorted by area in descending order (bigger objects go first).

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.ObjectsOrder.YX
member.summary: Objects are sorted by Y coordinate, then by X coordinate in ascending order (smaller coordinates go first).

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.ObjectsOrder.XY
member.summary: Objects are sorted by X coordinate, then by Y coordinate in ascending order (smaller coordinates go first).

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase
member.summary: Base class for different blob counting algorithms.

remarks.para: The class is abstract and serves as a base for different blob counting algorithms. Classes, which inherit from this base class, require to implement method, which does actual building of object's label's map.

For blobs' searcing usually all inherited classes accept binary images, which are actually grayscale thresholded images. But the exact supported format should be checked in particular class, inheriting from the base class. For blobs' extraction the class supports grayscale (8 bpp indexed) and color images (24 and 32 bpp).
Sample usage:

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.objectsCount
member.summary: Objects count.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.objectLabels
member.summary: Objects' labels.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.imageWidth
member.summary: Width of processed image.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.imageHeight
member.summary: Height of processed image.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.ObjectsCount
member.summary: Objects count.

remarks.para: Number of objects (blobs) found by method.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.ObjectLabels
member.summary: Objects' labels.
member.remarks: The array of width * height size, which holds labels for all objects. Background is represented with 0 value, but objects are represented with labels starting from 1.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.ObjectsOrder
member.summary: Objects sort order.

remarks.para: The property specifies objects' sort order, which are provided by , , etc.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.FilterBlobs
member.summary: Specifies if blobs should be filtered.

remarks.para: If the property is equal to false, then there is no any additional post processing after image was processed. If the property is set to true, then blobs filtering is done right after image processing routine. If is set, then custom blobs' filtering is done, which is implemented by user. Otherwise blobs are filtered according to dimensions specified in , , and properties.
Default value is set to .

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.CoupledSizeFiltering
member.summary: Specifies if size filetering should be coupled or not.

remarks.para: In uncoupled filtering mode, objects are filtered out in the case if their width is smaller than or height is smaller than . But in coupled filtering mode, objects are filtered out in the case if their width is smaller than and height is smaller than . In both modes the idea with filtering by objects' maximum size is the same as filtering by objects' minimum size.
Default value is set to , what means uncoupled filtering by size.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.MinWidth
member.summary: Minimum allowed width of blob.

remarks.para: The property specifies minimum object's width acceptable by blob counting routine and has power only when property is set to and custom blobs' filter is set to .
See documentation to for additional information.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.MinHeight

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.GetBlobsLeftAndRightEdges(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob,System.Collections.Generic.List{VisioForge.Libs.AForge.IntPoint}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{VisioForge.Libs.AForge.IntPoint}@)
member.summary: Get list of points on the left and right edges of the blob.
member.param: Blob to collect edge points for.
List of points on the left edge of the blob.
List of points on the right edge of the blob.

remarks.para: The method scans each line of the blob and finds the most left and the most right points for it adding them to appropriate lists. The method may be very useful in conjunction with different routines from , which allow finding convex hull or quadrilateral's corners.

para.note: Both lists of points are sorted by Y coordinate - points with smaller Y value go first.

member.exception: No image was processed before, so blob can not be extracted.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.GetBlobsTopAndBottomEdges(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob,System.Collections.Generic.List{VisioForge.Libs.AForge.IntPoint}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{VisioForge.Libs.AForge.IntPoint}@)
member.summary: Get list of points on the top and bottom edges of the blob.
member.param: Blob to collect edge points for.
List of points on the top edge of the blob.
List of points on the bottom edge of the blob.

remarks.para: The method scans each column of the blob and finds the most top and the most bottom points for it adding them to appropriate lists. The method may be very useful in conjunction with different routines from , which allow finding convex hull or quadrilateral's corners.

para.note: Both lists of points are sorted by X coordinate - points with smaller X value go first.

member.exception: No image was processed before, so blob can not be extracted.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.BlobCounterBase.GetBlobsEdgePoints(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Blob)
member.summary: Get list of object's edge points.
member.param: Blob to collect edge points for.
member.returns: Returns unsorted list of blob's edge points.

remarks.para: The method scans each row and column of the blob and finds the most top/bottom/left/right points. The method returns similar result as if results of both and methods were combined, but each edge point occurs only once in the list.

para.note: Edge points in the returned list are not ordered. This makes the list unusable for visualization with methods, which draw polygon or poly-line. But the returned list can be used with such algorithms, like convex hull search, shape analyzer, etc.

member.exception: No image was processed before, so blob can not be extracted.

remarks.note: By the time this method is called bitmap's pixel format is not yet checked, so this should be done by the class inheriting from the base class. and members are initialized before the method is called, so these members may be used safely.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Drawing
member.summary: Drawing primitives.

remarks.para: The class allows to do drawing of some primitives directly on locked image data or unmanaged image.

para.note: All methods of this class support drawing only on color 24/32 bpp images and on grayscale 8 bpp indexed images.
When it comes to alpha blending for 24/32 bpp images, all calculations are done as described on Wikipeadia (see "over" operator).

remarks.para: The unsupported image format exception is thrown in the case when user passes an image of certain format to an image processing routine, which does not support the format. Check documentation of the image processing routine to discover which formats are supported by the routine.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnsupportedImageFormatException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnsupportedImageFormatException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Message providing some additional information.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnsupportedImageFormatException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Message providing some additional information.
Name of the invalid parameter.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.InvalidImagePropertiesException
member.summary: Invalid image properties exception.

remarks.para: The invalid image properties exception is thrown in the case when user provides an image with certain properties, which are treated as invalid by particular image processing routine. Another case when this exception is thrown is the case when user tries to access some properties of an image (or of a recently processed image by some routine), which are not valid for that image.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.InvalidImagePropertiesException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: Message providing some additional information.
Name of the invalid parameter.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.ExhaustiveTemplateMatching
member.summary: Exhaustive template matching.

remarks.para: The class implements exhaustive template matching algorithm, which performs complete scan of source image, comparing each pixel with corresponding pixel of template.
The class processes only grayscale 8 bpp and color 24 bpp images.
Sample usage:
The class also can be used to get similarity level between two image of the same size, which can be useful to get information about how different/similar are images:

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.ExhaustiveTemplateMatching.SimilarityThreshold
member.summary: Similarity threshold, [0..1].

remarks.para: The property sets the minimal acceptable similarity between template and potential found candidate. If similarity is lower than this value, then object is not treated as matching with template.
Default value is set to 0.9.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.ExhaustiveTemplateMatching.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Similarity threshold.

member.summary: Process image looking for matchings with specified template.

Template image to search for.
member.returns: Returns array of found template matches. The array is sorted by similarity of found matches in descending order.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.BaseFilter
member.summary: Base class for filters, which produce new image of the same size as a result of image processing.

remarks.para: The abstract class is the base class for all filters, which do image processing creating new image with the same size as source. Filters based on this class cannot be applied directly to the source image, which is kept unchanged.

The base class itself does not define supported pixel formats of source image and resulting pixel formats of destination image. Filters inheriting from this base class, should specify supported pixel formats and their transformations overriding abstract property.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.BaseFilter.FormatTranslations
member.summary: Format translations dictionary.

remarks.para: The dictionary defines, which pixel formats are supported for source images and which pixel format will be used for resulting image.
See for more information.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.BaseFilter.Apply(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Apply filter to an image.
member.param: Source image to apply filter to.
member.returns: Returns filter's result obtained by applying the filter to the source image.
member.remarks: The method keeps the source image unchanged and returns the result of image processing filter as new image.
member.exception: Unsupported pixel format of the source image.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.BaseFilter.Apply(System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData)
member.summary: Apply filter to an image.
member.param: Source image to apply filter to.
member.returns: Returns filter's result obtained by applying the filter to the source image.
member.remarks: The filter accepts bitmap data as input and returns the result of image processing filter as new image. The source image data are kept unchanged.
member.exception: Unsupported pixel format of the source image.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.BaseFilter.Apply(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage)
member.summary: Apply filter to an image in unmanaged memory.
member.param: Source image in unmanaged memory to apply filter to.
member.returns: Returns filter's result obtained by applying the filter to the source image.
member.remarks: The method keeps the source image unchanged and returns the result of image processing filter as new image.
member.exception: Unsupported pixel format of the source image.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.BaseFilter.Apply(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage,VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage)
member.summary: Apply filter to an image in unmanaged memory.
member.param: Source image in unmanaged memory to apply filter to.
Destination image in unmanaged memory to put result into.

remarks.para: The method keeps the source image unchanged and puts result of image processing into destination image.

para.note: The destination image must have the same width and height as source image. Also destination image must have pixel format, which is expected by particular filter (see property for information about pixel format conversions).

member.exception: Unsupported pixel format of the source image.
Destination image has wrong width and/or height.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.BaseUsingCopyPartialFilter
member.summary: Base class for filters, which require source image backup to make them applicable to source image (or its part) directly.

remarks.para: The base class is used for filters, which can not do direct manipulations with source image. To make effect of in-place filtering, these filters create a background copy of the original image (done by this base class) and then do manipulations with it putting result back to the original source image.

para.note: The background copy of the source image is created only in the case of in-place filtering. Otherwise background copy is not created - source image is processed and result is put to destination image.

remarks.para: The base class is for those filters, which support as filtering entire image, as partial filtering of specified rectangle only.

member.summary: Color filtering in HSL color space.

The filter accepts 24 and 32 bpp color images for processing.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.IFilterInformation
member.summary: Interface which provides information about image processing filter.

remarks.para: The interface defines set of properties, which provide different type of information about image processing filters implementing interface or another filter's interface.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.IFilterInformation.FormatTranslations
member.summary: Format translations dictionary.

remarks.para: The dictionary defines, which pixel formats are supported for source images and which pixel format will be used for resulting image.

Keys of this dictionary defines all pixel formats which are supported for source images, but corresponding values define what will be resulting pixel format. For example, if value Format16bppGrayScale is put into the dictionary with the Format48bppRgb key, then it means that the filter accepts color 48 bpp image and produces 16 bpp grayscale image as a result of image processing.

The information provided by this property is mostly actual for filters, which can not be applied directly to the source image, but provide new image a result. Since usually all filters implement interface, the information provided by this property (if filter also implements interface) may be useful to user to resolve filter's capabilities.
Sample usage:

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.IInPlaceFilter
member.summary: In-place filter interface.
member.remarks: The interface defines the set of methods, which should be implemented by filters, which are capable to do image processing directly on the source image. Not all image processing filters can be applied directly to the source image - only filters, which do not change image's dimension and pixel format, can be applied directly to the source image.

member.summary: In-place partial filter interface.

remarks.para: The interface defines the set of methods, which should be implemented by filters, which are capable to do image processing directly on the source image. Not all image processing filters can be applied directly to the source image - only filters, which do not change image dimension and pixel format, can be applied directly to the source image.
The interface also supports partial image filtering, allowing to specify image rectangle, which should be filtered.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.BinaryDilatation3x3
member.summary: Binary dilatation operator from Mathematical Morphology with 3x3 structuring element.

remarks.para: The filter represents an optimized version of filter, which is aimed for binary images (containing black and white pixels) processed with 3x3 structuring element. This makes this filter ideal for growing objects in binary images it puts white pixel to the destination image in the case if there is at least one white neighbouring pixel in the source image.
See filter, which represents generic version of dilatation filter supporting custom structuring elements and wider range of image formats.
The filter accepts 8 bpp grayscale (binary) images for processing.

member.summary: Process the filter on the specified image.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Filters.BinaryErosion3x3
member.summary: Binary erosion operator from Mathematical Morphology with 3x3 structuring element.

remarks.para: The filter represents an optimized version of filter, which is aimed for binary images (containing black and white pixels) processed with 3x3 structuring element. This makes this filter ideal for removing noise in binary images it removes all white pixels, which are neighbouring with at least one blank pixel.
See filter, which represents generic version of erosion filter supporting custom structuring elements and wider range of image formats.
The filter accepts 8 bpp grayscale (binary) images for processing.

member.summary: Core image relatad methods.
member.remarks: All methods of this class are static and represent general routines used by different image processing classes.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Image.IsGrayscale(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Check if specified 8 bpp image is grayscale.
member.param: Image to check.
member.returns: Returns true if the image is grayscale or false otherwise.
member.remarks: The methods checks if the image is a grayscale image of 256 gradients. The method first examines if the image's pixel format is Format8bppIndexed and then it examines its palette to check if the image is grayscale or not.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Image.CreateGrayscaleImage(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create and initialize new 8 bpp grayscale image.
member.param: Image width.
Image height.
member.returns: Returns the created grayscale image.
member.remarks: The method creates new 8 bpp grayscale image and initializes its palette. Grayscale image is represented as Format8bppIndexed image with palette initialized to 256 gradients of gray color.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Image.SetGrayscalePalette(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Set pallete of the 8 bpp indexed image to grayscale.
member.param: Image to initialize.
member.remarks: The method initializes palette of Format8bppIndexed image with 256 gradients of gray color.
member.exception: Provided image is not 8 bpp indexed image.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Image.Clone(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat)
member.summary: Clone image.
member.param: Source image.
Pixel format of result image.
member.returns: Returns clone of the source image with specified pixel format.
member.remarks: The original Bitmap.Clone() does not produce the desired result - it does not create a clone with specified pixel format. More of it, the original method does not create an actual clone - it does not create a copy of the image. That is why this method was implemented to provide the functionality.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Image.Clone(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Clone image.
member.param: Source image.
member.returns: Return clone of the source image.
member.remarks: The original Bitmap.Clone() does not produce the desired result - it does not create an actual clone (it does not create a copy of the image). That is why this method was implemented to provide the functionality.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Image.Clone(System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData)
member.summary: Clone image.
member.param: Source image data.
member.returns: Clones image from source image data. The message does not clone pallete in the case if the source image has indexed pixel format.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Image.FormatImage(System.Drawing.Bitmap@)
member.summary: Format an image.
member.param: Source image to format.

remarks.para: Formats the image to one of the formats, which are supported by the AForge.Imaging library. The image is left untouched in the case if it is already of Format24bppRgb or Format32bppRgb or Format32bppArgb or Format48bppRgb or Format64bppArgb format or it is grayscale, otherwise the image is converted to Format24bppRgb format.

para.note: The method is deprecated and method should be used instead with specifying desired pixel format.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.Image.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Load bitmap from file.
member.param: File name to load bitmap from.
member.returns: Returns loaded bitmap.

remarks.para: The method is provided as an alternative of method to solve the issues of locked file. The standard .NET's method locks the source file until image's object is disposed, so the file can not be deleted or overwritten. This method workarounds the issue and does not lock the source file.
Sample usage:
remarks.code: Bitmap image = AForge.Imaging.Image.FromFile( "test.jpg" );

member.returns: Returns new image which is a copy of the source image but with 8 bits per plane.
