member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager
member.summary: Internal memory manager used by image processing routines.

remarks.para: The memory manager supports memory allocation/deallocation caching. Caching means that memory blocks may be not freed on request, but kept for later reuse.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.MaximumCacheSize
member.summary: Maximum amount of memory blocks to keep in cache.

remarks.para: The value specifies the amount of memory blocks, which could be cached by the memory manager.
Default value is set to 3. Maximum value is 10.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.CurrentCacheSize
member.summary: Current amount of memory blocks in cache.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.BusyMemoryBlocks
member.summary: Amount of busy memory blocks in cache (which were not freed yet by user).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.FreeMemoryBlocks
member.summary: Amount of free memory blocks in cache (which are not busy by users).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.CachedMemory
member.summary: Amount of cached memory in bytes.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.MaxSizeToCache
member.summary: Maximum memory block's size in bytes, which could be cached.
member.remarks: Memory blocks, which size is greater than this value, are not cached.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.MinSizeToCache
member.summary: Minimum memory block's size in bytes, which could be cached.
member.remarks: Memory blocks, which size is less than this value, are not cached.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.Alloc(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocate unmanaged memory.
member.param: Memory size to allocate.
member.returns: Return's pointer to the allocated memory buffer.
member.remarks: The method allocates requested amount of memory and returns pointer to it. It may avoid allocation in the case some caching scheme is uses and there is already enough allocated memory available.
member.exception: There is insufficient memory to satisfy the request.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.Free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Free unmanaged memory.
member.param: Pointer to memory buffer to free.
member.remarks: This method may skip actual deallocation of memory and keep it for future requests, if some caching scheme is used.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.MemoryManager.FreeUnusedMemory
member.summary: Force freeing unused memory.
member.remarks: Frees and removes from cache memory blocks, which are not used by users.
member.returns: Returns number of freed memory blocks.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage
member.summary: Image in unmanaged memory.

remarks.para: The class represents wrapper of an image in unmanaged memory. Using this class it is possible as to allocate new image in unmanaged memory, as to just wrap provided pointer to unmanaged memory, where an image is stored.

Usage of unmanaged images is mostly beneficial when it is required to apply multiple image processing routines to a single image. In such scenario usage of .NET managed images usually leads to worse performance, because each routine needs to lock managed image before image processing is done and then unlock it after image processing is done. Without these lock/unlock there is no way to get direct access to managed image's data, which means there is no way to do fast image processing. So, usage of managed images lead to overhead, which is caused by locks/unlock. Unmanaged images are represented internally using unmanaged memory buffer. This means that it is not required to do any locks/unlocks in order to get access to image data (no overhead).
Sample usage:

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.ImageData
member.summary: Pointer to image data in unmanaged memory.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.Width
member.summary: Image width in pixels.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.Height
member.summary: Image height in pixels.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.Stride
member.summary: Image stride (line size in bytes).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.PixelFormat
member.summary: Image pixel format.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Pointer to image data in unmanaged memory.
Image width in pixels.
Image height in pixels.
Image stride (line size in bytes).
Image pixel format.

para.note: Using this constructor, make sure all specified image attributes are correct and correspond to unmanaged memory buffer. If some attributes are specified incorrectly, this may lead to exceptions working with the unmanaged memory.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.#ctor(System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Locked bitmap data.

remarks.note: Unlike method, this constructor does not make copy of managed image. This means that managed image must stay locked for the time of using the instance of unamanged image.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.Finalize
member.summary: Destroys the instance of the class.

member.summary: Dispose the object.

remarks.para: Frees unmanaged resources used by the object. The object becomes unusable after that.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the object.
member.param: Indicates if disposing was initiated manually.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.Clone
member.summary: Clone the unmanaged images.
member.returns: Returns clone of the unmanaged image.

remarks.para: The method does complete cloning of the object.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.Copy(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage)
member.summary: Copy unmanaged image.
member.param: Destination image to copy this image to.

remarks.para: The method copies current unmanaged image to the specified image. Size and pixel format of the destination image must be exactly the same.

member.exception: Destination image has different size or pixel format.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.Create(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat)
member.summary: Allocate new image in unmanaged memory.
member.param: Image width.
Image height.
Image pixel format.
member.returns: Return image allocated in unmanaged memory.

remarks.para: Allocate new image with specified attributes in unmanaged memory.

para.note: The method supports only Format8bppIndexed, Format16bppGrayScale, Format24bppRgb, Format32bppRgb, Format32bppArgb, Format32bppPArgb, Format48bppRgb, Format64bppArgb and Format64bppPArgb pixel formats. In the case if Format8bppIndexed format is specified, pallete is not not created for the image (supposed that it is 8 bpp grayscale image).

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.ToManagedImage
member.summary: Create managed image from the unmanaged.
member.returns: Returns managed copy of the unmanaged image.

remarks.para: The method creates a managed copy of the unmanaged image with the same size and pixel format (it calls specifying for the makeCopy parameter).

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.ToManagedImage(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create managed image from the unmanaged.
member.param: Make a copy of the unmanaged image or not.
member.returns: Returns managed copy of the unmanaged image.

remarks.para: If the is set to , then the method creates a managed copy of the unmanaged image, so the managed image stays valid even when the unmanaged image gets disposed. However, setting this parameter to creates a managed image which is just a wrapper around the unmanaged image. So if unmanaged image is disposed, the managed image becomes no longer valid and accessing it will generate an exception.

member.exception: The unmanaged image has some invalid properties, which results in failure of converting it to managed image. This may happen if user used the constructor specifying some invalid parameters.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.FromManagedImage(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Create unmanaged image from the specified managed image.
member.param: Source managed image.
member.returns: Returns new unmanaged image, which is a copy of source managed image.

remarks.para: The method creates an exact copy of specified managed image, but allocated in unmanaged memory.

member.exception: Unsupported pixel format of source image.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.FromManagedImage(System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData)
member.summary: Create unmanaged image from the specified managed image.
member.param: Source locked image data.
member.returns: Returns new unmanaged image, which is a copy of source managed image.

remarks.para: The method creates an exact copy of specified managed image, but allocated in unmanaged memory. This means that managed image may be unlocked right after call to this method.

member.exception: Unsupported pixel format of source image.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.Collect8bppPixelValues(System.Collections.Generic.List{VisioForge.Libs.AForge.IntPoint})
member.summary: Collect pixel values from the specified list of coordinates.
member.param: List of coordinates to collect pixels' value from.
member.returns: Returns array of pixels' values from the specified coordinates.

remarks.para: The method goes through the specified list of points and for each point retrievs corresponding pixel's value from the unmanaged image.

para.note: For grayscale image the output array has the same length as number of points in the specified list of points. For color image the output array has triple length, containing pixels' values in RGB order.
The method does not make any checks for valid coordinates and leaves this up to user. If specified coordinates are out of image's bounds, the result is not predictable (crash in most cases).
This method is supposed for images with 8 bpp channels only (8 bpp grayscale image and 24/32 bpp color images).

member.exception: Unsupported pixel format of the source image. Use Collect16bppPixelValues() method for images with 16 bpp channels.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.CollectActivePixels
member.summary: Collect coordinates of none black pixels in the image.
member.returns: Returns list of points, which have other than black color.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.CollectActivePixels(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Collect coordinates of none black pixels within specified rectangle of the image.
member.param: Image's rectangle to process.
member.returns: Returns list of points, which have other than black color.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.SetPixels(System.Collections.Generic.List{VisioForge.Libs.AForge.IntPoint},System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Set pixels with the specified coordinates to the specified color.
member.param: List of points to set color for.
Color to set for the specified points.

para.note: For images having 16 bpp per color plane, the method extends the specified color value to 16 bit by multiplying it by 256.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.SetPixel(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.IntPoint,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Set pixel with the specified coordinates to the specified color.
member.param: Point's coordiates to set color for.
Color to set for the pixel.

remarks.para: See for more information.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.SetPixel(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Set pixel with the specified coordinates to the specified color.
member.param: X coordinate of the pixel to set.
Y coordinate of the pixel to set.
Color to set for the pixel.

para.note: For images having 16 bpp per color plane, the method extends the specified color value to 16 bit by multiplying it by 256.

remarks.para:
For grayscale images this method will calculate intensity value based on the below formula:
0.2125 * Red + 0.7154 * Green + 0.0721 * Blue

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.SetPixel(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte)
member.summary: Set pixel with the specified coordinates to the specified value.
member.param: X coordinate of the pixel to set.
Y coordinate of the pixel to set.
Pixel value to set.

remarks.para: The method sets all color components of the pixel to the specified value. If it is a grayscale image, then pixel's intensity is set to the specified value. If it is a color image, then pixel's R/G/B components are set to the same specified value (if an image has alpha channel, then it is set to maximum value - 255 or 65535).

para.note: For images having 16 bpp per color plane, the method extends the specified color value to 16 bit by multiplying it by 256.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage.GetPixel(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.IntPoint)

member.summary: Get color of the pixel with the specified coordinates.

Y coordinate of the pixel to get.
member.returns: Return pixel's color at the specified coordinates.

para.note: In the case if the image has 8 bpp grayscale format, the method will return a color with all R/G/B components set to same value, which is grayscale intensity.
The method supports only 8 bpp grayscale images and 24/32 bpp color images so far.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Math.Geometry.Line
member.summary: The class encapsulates 2D line and provides some tool methods related to lines.

remarks.para: The class provides some methods which are related to lines: angle between lines, distance to point, finding intersection point, etc.

Generally, the equation of the line is y = * x + . However, when is an Infinity, would normally be meaningless, and it would be impossible to distinguish the line x = 5 from the line x = -5. Therefore, if is or , the line's equation is instead x = .
Sample usage:

member.summary: If not , gets the Line's Y-intercept. If gets the line's X-intercept.

member.summary: Creates a that goes through the two specified points.
member.param: One point on the line.
Another point on the line.

member.exception: Thrown if the two points are the same.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Math.Geometry.Line.FromSlopeIntercept(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a with the specified slope and intercept.
member.param: The slope of the line
The Y-intercept of the line, unless the slope is an infinity, in which case the line's equation is "x = intercept" instead.
member.returns: Returns a representing the specified line.

remarks.para: The construction here follows the same rules as for the rest of this class. Most lines are expressed as y = slope * x + intercept. Vertical lines, however, are x = intercept. This is indicated by being true or by returning or .

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Math.Geometry.Line.FromRTheta(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a from a radius and an angle (in degrees).
member.param: The minimum distance from the line to the origin.
The angle of the vector from the origin to the line.
member.returns: Returns a representing the specified line.

remarks.para: is the minimum distance from the origin to the line, and is the counterclockwise rotation from the positive X axis to the vector through the origin and normal to the line.

This means that if is in [0,180), the point on the line closest to the origin is on the positive X or Y axes, or in quadrants I or II. Likewise, if is in [180,360), the point on the line closest to the origin is on the negative X or Y axes, or in quadrants III or IV.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Math.Geometry.Line.FromPointTheta(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Point,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a from a point and an angle (in degrees).
member.param: The minimum distance from the line to the origin.
The angle of the normal vector from the origin to the line.

remarks.para: is the counterclockwise rotation from the positive X axis to the vector through the origin and normal to the line.

This means that if is in [0,180), the point on the line closest to the origin is on the positive X or Y axes, or in quadrants I or II. Likewise, if is in [180,360), the point on the line closest to the origin is on the negative X or Y axes, or in quadrants III or IV.

member.returns: Returns a representing the specified line.

member.name: E:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Video.IVideoSource.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients about new available video frame.

para.note: Since video source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed video frame, but video source is responsible for disposing its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Video.IVideoSource.VideoSourceError
member.summary: Video source error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in video source object, for example internal exceptions.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.BlobCountingObjectsProcessing
member.summary: Motion processing algorithm, which counts separate moving objects and highlights them.

remarks.para: The aim of this motion processing algorithm is to count separate objects in the motion frame, which is provided by motion detection algorithm. In the case if property is set to , found objects are also highlighted on the original video frame. The algorithm counts and highlights only those objects, which size satisfies and properties.

para.note: The motion processing algorithm is supposed to be used only with motion detection algorithms, which are based on finding difference with background frame (see and as simple implementations) and allow extract moving objects clearly.

remarks.para: Sample usage:

member.summary: Highlight motion regions or not.

remarks.para: The property specifies if detected moving objects should be highlighted with rectangle or not.
Default value is set to .

para.note: Turning the value on leads to additional processing time of video frame.

member.summary: Color used to highlight motion regions.

remarks.para: Default value is set to red color.

member.summary: Minimum width of acceptable object.

remarks.para: The property sets minimum width of an object to count and highlight. If objects have smaller width, they are not counted and are not highlighted.
Default value is set to 10.

member.summary: Minimum height of acceptable object.

remarks.para: The property sets minimum height of an object to count and highlight. If objects have smaller height, they are not counted and are not highlighted.
Default value is set to 10.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.CustomFrameDifferenceDetector
member.summary: Motion detector based on difference with predefined background frame.

remarks.para: The class implements motion detection algorithm, which is based on difference of current video frame with predefined background frame. The difference frame is thresholded and the amount of difference pixels is calculated. To suppress stand-alone noisy pixels erosion morphological operator may be applied, which is controlled by property.

para.note: In the case if precise motion area's borders are required (for example, for further motion post processing), then property may be used to restore borders after noise suppression.
In the case if custom background frame is not specified by using method, the algorithm takes first video frame as a background frame and calculates difference of further video frames with it.

remarks.para: Unlike motion detection algorithm, this algorithm allows to identify quite clearly all objects, which are not part of the background (scene) - most likely moving objects.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.CustomFrameDifferenceDetector.DifferenceThreshold
member.summary: Difference threshold value, [1, 255].

remarks.para: The value specifies the amount off difference between pixels, which is treated as motion pixel.
Default value is set to 15.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.CustomFrameDifferenceDetector.MotionLevel
member.summary: Motion level value, [0, 1].

remarks.para: Amount of changes in the last processed frame. For example, if value of this property equals to 0.1, then it means that last processed frame has 10% difference with defined background frame.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.CustomFrameDifferenceDetector.MotionFrame
member.summary: Motion frame containing detected areas of motion.

remarks.para: Motion frame is a grayscale image, which shows areas of detected motion. All black pixels in the motion frame correspond to areas, where no motion is detected. But white pixels correspond to areas, where motion is detected.

para.note: The property is set to after processing of the first video frame by the algorithm in the case if custom background frame was not set manually by using method (it will be not after second call in this case). If correct custom background was set then the property should bet set to estimated motion frame after method call.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.CustomFrameDifferenceDetector.SuppressNoise
member.summary: Suppress noise in video frames or not.

remarks.para: The value specifies if additional filtering should be done to suppress standalone noisy pixels by applying 3x3 erosion image processing filter. See property, if it is required to restore edges of objects, which are not noise.
Default value is set to .

para.note: Turning the value on leads to more processing time of video frame.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.CustomFrameDifferenceDetector.KeepObjectsEdges
member.summary: Restore objects edges after noise suppression or not.

remarks.para: The value specifies if additional filtering should be done to restore objects' edges after noise suppression by applying 3x3 dilatation image processing filter.
Default value is set to .

para.note: Turning the value on leads to more processing time of video frame.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.CustomFrameDifferenceDetector.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Suppress noise in video frames or not (see property).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Suppress noise in video frames or not (see property).
Restore objects edges after noise suppression or not (see property).

member.summary: Process new video frame.
member.param: Video frame to process (detect motion in).

remarks.para: Processes new frame from video source and detects motion in it.
Check property to get information about amount of motion (changes) in the processed frame.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.CustomFrameDifferenceDetector.Reset
member.summary: Reset motion detector to initial state.

remarks.para: Resets internal state and variables of motion detection algorithm. Usually this is required to be done before processing new video source, but may be also done at any time to restart motion detection algorithm.

para.note: In the case if custom background frame was set using method, this method does not reset it. The method resets only automatically generated background frame.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.GridMotionAreaProcessing
member.summary: Motion processing algorithm, which performs grid processing of motion frame.

remarks.para: The aim of this motion processing algorithm is to do grid processing of motion frame. This means that entire motion frame is divided by a grid into certain amount of cells and the motion level is calculated for each cell. The information about each cell's motion level may be retrieved using property.

para.para: In addition the algorithm can highlight those cells, which have motion level above the specified threshold (see property). To enable this it is required to set property to .

remarks.para: Sample usage:

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.GridMotionAreaProcessing.HighlightColor
member.summary: Color used to highlight motion regions.

remarks.para: Default value is set to red color.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.GridMotionAreaProcessing.HighlightMotionGrid
member.summary: Highlight motion regions or not.

remarks.para: The property specifies if motion grid should be highlighted - if cell, which have motion level above the specified value, should be highlighted.
Default value is set to .

para.note: Turning the value on leads to additional processing time of video frame.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.GridMotionAreaProcessing.MotionAmountToHighlight
member.summary: Motion amount to highlight cell.

remarks.para: The property specifies motion level threshold for highlighting grid's cells. If motion level of a certain cell is higher than this value, then the cell is highlighted.
Default value is set to 0.15.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.GridMotionAreaProcessing.MotionGrid
member.summary: Motion levels of each grid's cell.

remarks.para: The property represents an array of size x, which keeps motion level of each grid's cell. If certain cell has motion level equal to 0.2, then it means that this cell has 20% of changes.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.GridMotionAreaProcessing.GridWidth
member.summary: Width of motion grid, [2, 64].

remarks.para: The property specifies motion grid's width - number of grid' columns.
Default value is set to 16.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.GridMotionAreaProcessing.GridHeight
member.summary: Height of motion grid, [2, 64].

remarks.para: The property specifies motion grid's height - number of grid' rows.
Default value is set to 16.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.IMotionDetector
member.summary: Interface of motion detector algorithm.

remarks.para: The interface specifies methods, which should be implemented by all motion detection algorithms - algorithms which perform processing of video frames in order to detect motion. Amount of detected motion may be checked using property. Also property may be used in order to see all the detected motion areas. For example, the property is used by motion processing algorithms for further motion post processing, like highlighting motion areas, counting number of detected moving object, etc.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.IMotionDetector.MotionLevel
member.summary: Motion level value, [0, 1].

remarks.para: Amount of changes in the last processed frame. For example, if value of this property equals to 0.1, then it means that last processed frame has 10% of changes (however it is up to specific implementation to decide how to compare specified frame).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.IMotionDetector.MotionFrame
member.summary: Motion frame containing detected areas of motion.

remarks.para: Motion frame is a grayscale image, which shows areas of detected motion. All black pixels in the motion frame correspond to areas, where no motion is detected. But white pixels correspond to areas, where motion is detected.

remarks.para: Processes new frame from video source and detects motion in it.

member.summary: Reset motion detector to initial state.

remarks.para: Resets internal state and variables of motion detection algorithm. Usually this is required to be done before processing new video source, but may be also done at any time to restart motion detection algorithm.

member.summary: Interface of motion processing algorithm.

remarks.para: The interface specifies methods, which should be implemented by all motion processng algorithms - algorithm which perform further post processing of detected motion, which is done by motion detection algorithms (see ).

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.IMotionProcessing.ProcessFrame(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage,VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage)
member.summary: Process video and motion frames doing further post processing after performed motion detection.
member.param: Original video frame.
Motion frame provided by motion detection algorithm (see ).

remarks.para: The method does father post processing of detected motion. Type of motion post processing is specified by specific implementation of the interface - it may motion area highlighting, motion objects counting, etc.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.IMotionProcessing.Reset
member.summary: Reset internal state of motion processing algorithm.

remarks.para: The method allows to reset internal state of motion processing algorithm and prepare it for processing of next video stream or to restart the algorithm.

para.note: Some motion processing algorithms may not have any stored internal states and may just process provided video frames without relying on any motion history etc. In this case such algorithms provide empty implementation of this method.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.MotionDetector
member.summary: Motion detection wrapper class, which performs motion detection and processing.

remarks.para: The class serves as a wrapper class for motion detection and motion processing algorithms, allowing to call them with single call. Unlike motion detection and motion processing interfaces, the class also provides additional methods for convenience, so the algorithms could be applied not only to , but to .NET's class as well.

In addition to wrapping of motion detection and processing algorthms, the class provides some additional functionality. Using property it is possible to specify set of rectangular zones to observe - only motion in these zones is counted and post procesed.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.MotionDetector.MotionDetectionAlgorithm
member.summary: Motion detection algorithm to apply to each video frame.

remarks.para: The property sets motion detection algorithm, which is used by method in order to calculate motion level and motion frame.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.MotionDetector.MotionProcessingAlgorithm
member.summary: Motion processing algorithm to apply to each video frame after motion detection is done.

remarks.para: The property sets motion processing algorithm, which is used by method after motion detection in order to do further post processing of motion frames. The aim of further post processing depends on actual implementation of the specified motion processing algorithm - it can be highlighting of motion area, objects counting, etc.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.MotionDetector.MotionZones
member.summary: Set of zones to detect motion in.

remarks.para: The property keeps array of rectangular zones, which are observed for motion detection. Motion outside of these zones is ignored.
In the case if this property is set, the method will filter out all motion witch was detected by motion detection algorithm, but is not located in the specified zones.

member.returns: Returns amount of motion, which is provided property of the motion detection algorithm in use.

remarks.para: See for additional details.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.MotionDetector.ProcessFrame(VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage)
member.summary: Process new video frame.
member.param: Video frame to process (detect motion in).
member.returns: Returns amount of motion, which is provided property of the motion detection algorithm in use.

remarks.para: The method first of all applies motion detection algorithm to the specified video frame to calculate motion level and motion frame. After this it applies motion processing algorithm (if it was set) to do further post processing, like highlighting motion areas, counting moving objects, etc.

para.note: In the case if property is set, this method will perform motion filtering right after motion algorithm is done and before passing motion frame to motion processing algorithm. The method does filtering right on the motion frame, which is produced by motion detection algorithm. At the same time the method recalculates motion level and returns new value, which takes motion zones into account (but the new value is not set back to motion detection algorithm' property).

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.MotionDetector.Reset
member.summary: Reset motion detector to initial state.

remarks.para: The method resets motion detection and motion processing algotithms by calling their and methods.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.SimpleBackgroundModelingDetector
member.summary: Motion detector based on simple background modeling.

remarks.para: The class implements motion detection algorithm, which is based on difference of current video frame with modeled background frame. The difference frame is thresholded and the amount of difference pixels is calculated. To suppress stand-alone noisy pixels erosion morphological operator may be applied, which is controlled by property.

para.note: In the case if precise motion area's borders are required (for example, for further motion post processing), then property may be used to restore borders after noise suppression.

remarks.para: As the first approximation of background frame, the first frame of video stream is taken. During further video processing the background frame is constantly updated, so it changes in the direction to decrease difference with current video frame (the background frame is moved towards current frame). See properties, which control the rate of background frame update.

Unlike motion detection algorithm, this algorithm allows to identify quite clearly all objects, which are not part of the background (scene) - most likely moving objects. And unlike motion detection algorithm, this algorithm includes background adaptation feature, which allows it to update its modeled background frame in order to take scene changes into account.

para.note: Because of the adaptation feature of the algorithm, it may adopt to background changes, what algorithm can not do. However, if moving object stays on the scene for a while (so algorithm adopts to it and does not treat it as a new moving object any more) and then starts to move again, the algorithm may find two moving objects - the true one, which is really moving, and the false one, which does not (the place, where the object stayed for a while).

The algorithm is not applicable to such cases, when moving object resides in camera's view most of the time (laptops camera monitoring a person sitting in front of it, for example). The algorithm is mostly supposed for cases, when camera monitors some sort of static scene, where moving objects appear from time to time - street, road, corridor, etc.

remarks.para: Sample usage:

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.SimpleBackgroundModelingDetector.DifferenceThreshold
member.summary: Difference threshold value, [1, 255].

remarks.para: The value specifies the amount off difference between pixels, which is treated as motion pixel.
Default value is set to 15.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.SimpleBackgroundModelingDetector.MotionLevel
member.summary: Motion level value, [0, 1].

remarks.para: Amount of changes in the last processed frame. For example, if value of this property equals to 0.1, then it means that last processed frame has 10% difference with modeled background frame.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.SimpleBackgroundModelingDetector.MotionFrame
member.summary: Motion frame containing detected areas of motion.

remarks.para: Motion frame is a grayscale image, which shows areas of detected motion. All black pixels in the motion frame correspond to areas, where no motion is detected. But white pixels correspond to areas, where motion is detected.

para.note: The property is set to after processing of the first video frame by the algorithm.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.SimpleBackgroundModelingDetector.SuppressNoise
member.summary: Suppress noise in video frames or not.

remarks.para: The value specifies if additional filtering should be done to suppress standalone noisy pixels by applying 3x3 erosion image processing filter. See property, if it is required to restore edges of objects, which are not noise.
Default value is set to .

para.note: Turning the value on leads to more processing time of video frame.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.SimpleBackgroundModelingDetector.KeepObjectsEdges
member.summary: Restore objects edges after noise suppression or not.

remarks.para: The value specifies if additional filtering should be done to restore objects' edges after noise suppression by applying 3x3 dilatation image processing filter.
Default value is set to .

para.note: Turning the value on leads to more processing time of video frame.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.SimpleBackgroundModelingDetector.FramesPerBackgroundUpdate
member.summary: Frames per background update, [1, 50].

remarks.para: The value controls the speed of modeled background adaptation to scene changes. After each specified amount of frames the background frame is updated in the direction to decrease difference with current processing frame.
Default value is set to 2.

para.note: The property has effect only in the case if property is set to 0. Otherwise it does not have effect and background update is managed according to the property settings.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.SimpleBackgroundModelingDetector.MillisecondsPerBackgroundUpdate
member.summary: Milliseconds per background update, [0, 5000].

remarks.para: The value represents alternate way of controlling the speed of modeled background adaptation to scene changes. The value sets number of milliseconds, which should elapse between two consequent video frames to result in background update for one intensity level. For example, if this value is set to 100 milliseconds and the amount of time elapsed between two last video frames equals to 350, then background frame will be update for 3 intensity levels in the direction to decrease difference with current video frame (the remained 50 milliseconds will be added to time difference between two next consequent frames, so the accuracy is preserved).

Unlike background update method controlled using method, the method guided by this property is not affected by changes in frame rates. If, for some reasons, a video source starts to provide delays between frames (frame rate drops down), the amount of background update still stays consistent. When background update is controlled by this property, it is always possible to estimate amount of time required to change, for example, absolutely black background (0 intensity values) into absolutely white background (255 intensity values). If value of this property is set to 100, then it will take approximately 25.5 seconds for such update regardless of frame rate.

para.note: Background update controlled by this property is slightly slower then background update controlled by property, so it has a bit greater impact on performance.
If this property is set to 0, then corresponding background updating method is not used (turned off), but background update guided by property is used.

remarks.para: Default value is set to 0.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.TwoFramesDifferenceDetector
member.summary: Motion detector based on two continues frames difference.

remarks.para: The class implements the simplest motion detection algorithm, which is based on difference of two continues frames. The difference frame is thresholded and the amount of difference pixels is calculated. To suppress stand-alone noisy pixels erosion morphological operator may be applied, which is controlled by property.

Although the class may be used on its own to perform motion detection, it is preferred to use it in conjunction with class, which provides additional features and allows to use moton post processing algorithms.
Sample usage:

Default value is set to 15.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Libs.AForge.Vision.Motion.TwoFramesDifferenceDetector.MotionFrame

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty
member.summary: From CameraControlProperty
member.remarks: For a given property, a particular device might implement only a subset of the listed range.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.Pan
member.summary: Specifies the camera's pan setting, in degrees. Values range from 180 to +180, with the default set to zero. Positive values are clockwise from the origin (the camera rotates clockwise when viewed from above), and negative values are counterclockwise from the origin.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.Tilt
member.summary: Specifies the camera's tilt setting, in degrees. Values range from 180 to +180, with the default set to zero. Positive values point the imaging plane up, and negative values point the imaging plane down.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.Roll
member.summary: Specifies the camera's roll setting, in degrees. Values range from 180 to +180, with the default set to zero. Positive values cause a clockwise rotation of the camera along the image-viewing axis, and negative values cause a counterclockwise rotation of the camera.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.Zoom
member.summary: Specifies the camera's zoom setting, in millimeters. Values range from 10 to 600, and the default is specific to the device.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.Exposure
member.summary: Specifies the exposure setting, in log base 2 seconds. In other words, for values less than zero, the exposure time is 1/2n seconds, and for values zero or above, the exposure time is 2n seconds. For example: Value: Seconds: -3 1/8 -2 1/4 -1 1/2 0 1 1 2 2 4

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.Iris
member.summary: Specifies the camera's iris setting, in units of f(stop) * 10.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.Focus
member.summary: Specifies the camera's focus setting, as the distance to the optimally focused target, in millimeters. The range and default value are specific to the device.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.ScanMode
member.summary: The ScanMode property specifies the scanning mode of the camera sensor. The property value specifies whether interlace mode should be enabled. A value of 0 indicates that the interlace mode is enabled, and a value of 1 indicates that the progressive (or non-interlace) mode is enabled.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.Privacy
member.summary: The Privacy property specifies whether to prevent video from being acquired by the camera sensor. The property value specifies whether privacy mode is enable or disabled. A value of 0 indicates that the camera sensor can capture video images, and a value of 1 indicates that the camera sensor is prevented from capturing video images.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.PanTilt
member.summary: The PanTilt property specifies absolute pan and tilt settings. The property value is a pair of integers that specify a camera's absolute pan and tilt settings. These values are expressed in arc-second units. One arc second is 1/3600 of a degree. Acceptable values range from 180*3600 to +180*3600 arc seconds. If a pan or tilt value is not provided, the default is 0. When making a pan request, specify a positive value to rotate the camera to the right and specify a negative value to rotate the camera to the left. When making a tilt request, a positive value tilts the camera up and a negative value tilts the camera down.
member.remarks: NOT IMPLEMENTED.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.PanRelative
member.summary: The PanRelative property specifies a camera's rotation around the vertical axis. The property value specifies a camera's relative pan setting. The size of the value represents the desired pan speed; a higher value represents a higher speed.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.TiltRelative
member.summary: The TileRelative property specifies a camera's vertical tilting status. The property value specifies a camera's relative tilt setting. The size of the value represents the desired tilt speed; a higher value represents a higher speed.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.RollRelative
member.summary: The RollRelative property specifies camera rotation around the image viewing axis. The property value specifies a camera's relative roll setting. The size of the value represents the desired rotation speed; a higher value represents a higher speed.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.ZoomRelative
member.summary: The ZoomRelative property specifies the zoom status of the camera. The property value specifies a camera's relative zoom setting. The size of the value represents the desired zoom speed; a higher value represents a higher speed.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.ExposureRelative
member.summary: The ExposureRelative property specifies the electronic shutter speed. The property value specifies a camera's relative exposure setting. Step size is hardware-dependent. To determine the step size, you can make a get request on the Exposure property.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.IrisRelative
member.summary: The IrisRelative property specifies a camera's aperture setting. The property value specifies a camera's relative iris setting. Both the iris step size and the iris step default value are implementation-specific.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.FocusRelative
member.summary: The FocusRelative property specifies the focus setting of the camera. The property value specifies a camera's relative focus setting. The size of the value represents the speed at which the focal point changes; a higher value represents a higher speed.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.PanTiltRelative
member.summary: The PanTiltRelative property specifies horizontal or vertical rotation of the camera and can specify both simultaneously.
member.remarks: NOT IMPLEMENTED.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.FocalLength
member.summary: The FocalLength property retrieves focal length information for a camera.] The property value specifies a camera's focal length.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlProperty.AutoExposurePriority
member.summary: The AutoExposurePriority property specifies whether the device can dynamically vary the frame rate. The property value specifies whether frame rate can be dynamically varied by the device. 0 - frame rate must remain constant. 1 - frame rate can be dynamically varied by the device.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlFlags
member.summary: From CameraControlFlags
member.remarks: Updated by VisioForge.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlFlags.None
member.summary: None or absolute.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlFlags.Auto
member.summary: The setting is controlled automatically.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlFlags.Manual
member.summary: The setting is controlled manually.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlFlags.Absolute
member.summary: The camera supports absolute units for this setting.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.CameraControlFlags.Relative
member.summary: The camera supports relative controls for this setting. A relative control is divided into a number of steps with no defined units. The absolute size of each step depends on the camera model.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.DirectShowLib.DES.DESError.ThrowExceptionForHR(System.Int32)

member.summary: The Read method reads a specified number of bytes from the streamIndex object into memory, starting at the current seek pointer.
member.param: A byte array which the streamIndex data is read into.
The number of bytes of data to read from the streamIndex object.

member.summary: The Write method writes a specified number of bytes into the streamIndex object starting at the current seek pointer.
member.param: A byte array that contains the data that is to be itemsRead to the streamIndex. A valid array must be provided for this parameter even when is zero.
The number of bytes of data to attempt to write into the streamIndex. This value can be zero.

A pointer to a variable where this method writes the actual number of bytes itemsRead to the streamIndex object. The caller can set this pointer to , in which case this method does not provide the actual number of bytes itemsRead.
member.returns: An HRESULT.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.Interop.ComCallableStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The Seek method changes the seek pointer to a new location. The new location is relative to either the beginning of the streamIndex, the end of the streamIndex, or the current seek pointer.
member.param: The displacement to be added to the location indicated by the parameter. If is , this is interpreted as an unsigned value rather than a signed value.

The origin for the displacement specified in . The origin can be the beginning of the file (), the current seek pointer (), or the end of the file (). For more information about values, see the enumeration.

A pointer to the location where this method writes the value of the new seek pointer from the beginning of the streamIndex. You can set this pointer to . In this case, this method does not provide the new seek pointer.
member.returns: An HRESULT.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.Interop.ComCallableStream.SetSize(System.Int64)
member.summary: The SetSize method changes the size of the streamIndex object.
member.param: Specifies the new size, in bytes, of the streamIndex.
member.returns: An HRESULT.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.Interop.ComCallableStream.CopyTo(VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.Misc.IStream,System.Int64,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The CopyTo method copies a specified number of bytes from the current seek pointer in the streamIndex to the current seek pointer in another streamIndex.
member.param: A pointer to the destination streamIndex. The streamIndex pointed to by can be a new streamIndex or a clone of the source streamIndex.
The number of bytes to copy from the source streamIndex.

A pointer to the location where this method writes the actual number of bytes read from the source. You can set this pointer to . In this case, this method does not provide the actual number of bytes read.

A pointer to the location where this method writes the actual number of bytes itemsRead to the destination. You can set this pointer to . In this case, this method does not provide the actual number of bytes itemsRead.
member.returns: An HRESULT.

member.remarks: Since transacted IO are not supported by managed streams, this method just call .

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.Interop.ComCallableStream.Revert
member.summary: The Revert method discards all changes that have been made to a transacted streamIndex since the last IStream::Commit call.

member.remarks: Since transacted IO are not supported by managed streams, this method do nothing.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.Interop.ComCallableStream.LockRegion(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: The LockRegion method restricts access to a specified range of bytes in the streamIndex. Supporting this functionality is optional since some file systems do not provide it.
member.param: Integer that specifies the byte offset for the beginning of the range.
Integer that specifies the length of the range, in bytes, to be restricted.
Specifies the restrictions being requested on accessing the range. This parameter is ignored by this implementation.
member.returns: An HRESULT.
member.remarks: This method only works if the wrapped streamIndex is a . For other Stream kinds, the method tell to the caller that locking is not supported.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.Interop.ComCallableStream.UnlockRegion(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: The UnlockRegion method removes the access restriction on a range of bytes previously restricted with .
member.param: Specifies the byte offset for the beginning of the range.
Specifies, in bytes, the length of the range to be restricted.
Specifies the access restrictions previously placed on the range. This parameter is ignored by this implementation.
member.returns: An HRESULT.
member.remarks: This method only works if the wrapped streamIndex is a . For other Stream kinds, the method tell to the caller that locking is not supported.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.MF.IsSupported
member.summary: Indicate if Media Foundation is available by the computer executing that method.
member.returns: true if Media Foundation is supported; false otherwise

remarks.para: On desktop OS, Media Foundation is only supported on Windows Vista or higher. On server OS, Media Foundation is only supported on Windows 2008 or higher as an installable feature.

The following specific Windows editions don't support Media Foundation without installing the corresponding Media Feature Pack:
Windows N editions Windows KN editions

member.summary: Creates the source resolver, which is used to create a media source from a URL or byte stream.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.MF.CreateDirectShowSourceResolver
member.summary: Creates the DirectShow source resolver.
member.returns: Returns an instance of the DirectShow source resolver.

remarks.para: The DirectShow source resolver is an undocumented component of Windows Media Player that is available since Windows Vista. Use it at your own risk.
This source resolver can wrap a DirectShow source filter as a Media Foundation media source. This allow reading file formats not supported natively by Media Foundation but by DirectShow.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.MF.Create2DMediaBuffer(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.IMFMediaBuffer@)
member.summary: Creates a system-memory buffer object to hold 2D image data.
member.param: Width of the image, in pixels.
Height of the image, in pixels.
A FOURCC code or D3DFORMAT value that specifies the video format.

If true, the buffer's IMF2DBuffer.ContiguousCopyTo method copies the buffer into a bottom-up format. The bottom-up format is compatible with GDI for uncompressed RGB images. If this parameter is false, the ContiguousCopyTo method copies the buffer into a top-down format, which is compatible with DirectX.
Receives an instance of the IMFMediaBuffer interface.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns the S_OK member. Otherwise, it returns another HResult's member that describe the error.

member.param: An instance of the DXGI surface.
The zero-based index of a subresource of the surface. The media buffer object is associated with this subresource.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.MediaFoundation.Misc.ConstPropVariant
member.summary:
ConstPropVariant is used for [In] parameters. This is important since for [In] parameters, you must *not* clear the PropVariant. The caller will need to do that himself.
Likewise, if you want to store a copy of a ConstPropVariant, you should store it to a PropVariant using the PropVariant constructor that takes a ConstPropVariant. If you try to store the ConstPropVariant, when the caller frees his copy, yours will no longer be valid.

member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Dsp.BiQuadFilter.LowShelf(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: H(s) = A * (s^2 + (sqrt(A)/Q)*s + A)/(A*s^2 + (sqrt(A)/Q)*s + 1)
member.param: a "shelf slope" parameter (for shelving EQ only). When S = 1, the shelf slope is as steep as it can be and remain monotonically increasing or decreasing gain with frequency. The shelf slope, in dB/octave, remains proportional to S for all other values for a fixed f0/Fs and dBgain.
Gain in decibels

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerInterop.MIXERLINE_LINEF.MIXERLINE_LINEF_SOURCE
member.summary: Audio line is an audio source line associated with a single audio destination line. If this flag is not set, this line is an audio destination line associated with zero or more audio source lines.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType
member.summary: Mixer Line Component type enumeration

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.DestinationUndefined
member.summary: Audio line is a destination that cannot be defined by one of the standard component types. A mixer device is required to use this component type for line component types that have not been defined by Microsoft Corporation. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_UNDEFINED

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.DestinationDigital
member.summary: Audio line is a digital destination (for example, digital input to a DAT or CD audio device). MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_DIGITAL

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.DestinationLine
member.summary: Audio line is a line level destination (for example, line level input from a CD audio device) that will be the final recording source for the analog-to-digital converter (ADC). Because most audio cards for personal computers provide some sort of gain for the recording audio source line, the mixer device will use the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN type. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_LINE

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.DestinationMonitor
member.summary: Audio line is a destination used for a monitor. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_MONITOR

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.DestinationSpeakers
member.summary: Audio line is an adjustable (gain and/or attenuation) destination intended to drive speakers. This is the typical component type for the audio output of audio cards for personal computers. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_SPEAKERS

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.DestinationHeadphones
member.summary: Audio line is an adjustable (gain and/or attenuation) destination intended to drive headphones. Most audio cards use the same audio destination line for speakers and headphones, in which case the mixer device simply uses the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_SPEAKERS type. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_HEADPHONES

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.DestinationTelephone
member.summary: Audio line is a destination that will be routed to a telephone line. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_TELEPHONE

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.DestinationWaveIn
member.summary: Audio line is a destination that will be the final recording source for the waveform-audio input (ADC). This line typically provides some sort of gain or attenuation. This is the typical component type for the recording line of most audio cards for personal computers. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.DestinationVoiceIn
member.summary: Audio line is a destination that will be the final recording source for voice input. This component type is exactly like MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN but is intended specifically for settings used during voice recording/recognition. Support for this line is optional for a mixer device. Many mixer devices provide only MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_VOICEIN

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceUndefined
member.summary: Audio line is a source that cannot be defined by one of the standard component types. A mixer device is required to use this component type for line component types that have not been defined by Microsoft Corporation. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_UNDEFINED

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceDigital
member.summary: Audio line is a digital source (for example, digital output from a DAT or audio CD). MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_DIGITAL

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceLine
member.summary: Audio line is a line-level source (for example, line-level input from an external stereo) that can be used as an optional recording source. Because most audio cards for personal computers provide some sort of gain for the recording source line, the mixer device will use the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_AUXILIARY type. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_LINE

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceMicrophone
member.summary: Audio line is a microphone recording source. Most audio cards for personal computers provide at least two types of recording sources: an auxiliary audio line and microphone input. A microphone audio line typically provides some sort of gain. Audio cards that use a single input for use with a microphone or auxiliary audio line should use the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_MICROPHONE component type. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_MICROPHONE

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceSynthesizer
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from the output of an internal synthesizer. Most audio cards for personal computers provide some sort of MIDI synthesizer (for example, an Adlib-compatible or OPL/3 FM synthesizer). MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_SYNTHESIZER

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceCompactDisc
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from the output of an internal audio CD. This component type is provided for audio cards that provide an audio source line intended to be connected to an audio CD (or CD-ROM playing an audio CD). MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_COMPACTDISC

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceTelephone
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from an incoming telephone line. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_TELEPHONE

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourcePcSpeaker
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from personal computer speaker. Several audio cards for personal computers provide the ability to mix what would typically be played on the internal speaker with the output of an audio card. Some audio cards support the ability to use this output as a recording source. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_PCSPEAKER

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceWaveOut
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from the waveform-audio output digital-to-analog converter (DAC). Most audio cards for personal computers provide this component type as a source to the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_SPEAKERS destination. Some cards also allow this source to be routed to the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN destination. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_WAVEOUT

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceAuxiliary
member.summary: Audio line is a source originating from the auxiliary audio line. This line type is intended as a source with gain or attenuation that can be routed to the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_SPEAKERS destination and/or recorded from the MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_DST_WAVEIN destination. MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_AUXILIARY

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Mixer.MixerLineComponentType.SourceAnalog
member.summary: Audio line is an analog source (for example, analog output from a video-cassette tape). MIXERLINE_COMPONENTTYPE_SRC_ANALOG

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Wave.WaveFormatEncoding.MPEG_ADTS_AAC
member.summary: Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) audio in Audio Data Transport Stream (ADTS) format. The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_ADTS_AAC.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral band replication (SBR) or parametric stereo (PS) tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Wave.WaveFormatEncoding.MPEG_RAW_AAC
member.remarks: Source wmCodec.h

member.name: F:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Wave.WaveFormatEncoding.MPEG_LOAS
member.summary: MPEG-4 audio transport stream with a synchronization layer (LOAS) and a multiplex layer (LATM). The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_LOAS.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral SBR or PS tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Wave.DirectSoundOut.DSEnumCallback
member.summary: The DSEnumCallback function is an application-defined callback function that enumerates the DirectSound drivers. The system calls this function in response to the application's call to the DirectSoundEnumerate or DirectSoundCaptureEnumerate function.
member.param: Address of the GUID that identifies the device being enumerated, or NULL for the primary device. This value can be passed to the DirectSoundCreate8 or DirectSoundCaptureCreate8 function to create a device object for that driver.
Address of a null-terminated string that provides a textual description of the DirectSound device.
Address of a null-terminated string that specifies the module name of the DirectSound driver corresponding to this device.
Address of application-defined data. This is the pointer passed to DirectSoundEnumerate or DirectSoundCaptureEnumerate as the lpContext parameter.
member.returns: Returns TRUE to continue enumerating drivers, or FALSE to stop.

member.param: callback function
User context

member.summary:
IWaveBuffer interface use to store wave datas. Data can be manipulated with arrays (,, , ) that are pointing to the same memory buffer. This is a requirement for all subclasses.
Use the associated Count property based on the type of buffer to get the number of data in the buffer.
for the standard implementation using C# unions.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.NAudio.Wave.WaveBuffer
member.summary:
WaveBuffer class use to store wave datas. Data can be manipulated with arrays (,,, ) that are pointing to the same memory buffer. Use the associated Count property based on the type of buffer to get the number of data in the buffer. Implicit casting is now supported to float[], byte[], int[], short[]. You must not use Length on returned arrays.
n.b. FieldOffset is 8 now to allow it to work natively on 64 bit

member.name: T:VisioForge.Libs.WebM.IVP8Encoder
member.summary: VP8 encoder filter interface.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.WebM.IVP8Encoder.ApplySettings
member.summary:
The filter maintains a set of encoder configuration values, held in cache. Any parameters set (using the methods below) are always applied to the cached value, irrespective of the state of the graph.
When the graph is started, the filter initializes the VP8 encoder using the cached configuration values. This is done automatically, as part of the activities associated with transitioning the filter from the stopped state.
If the graph has been started, then any parameters set by the user are still applied to the cache (as before). However, to apply the configuration values in cache to the VP8 encoder, the user must also call ApplySettings.
It is harmless to call ApplySettings while the graph is stopped.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Libs.WebM.IVP8Encoder.ResetSettings
member.summary: Sets the configuration values in cache to their defaults, the same as they had when the filter instance was originally created.

member.summary: Time to spend encoding, in microseconds.
member.param: Deadline time.

member.summary: For multi-threaded implementations, use no more than this number of threads. The codec may use fewer threads than allowed. The value 0 is equivalent to the value 1.
